thread.title: Popcorn Looks Even More Delicious in Super Slow Motion
thread.title_full: Popcorn Looks Even More Delicious in Super Slow Motion

author: Andrew Liszewski on Sploid, shared by Andrew Liszewski to Gizmodo
title: Popcorn Looks Even More Delicious in Super Slow Motion
text:
Go to permalink GIF 
Watching popcorn pop is utterly captivating, even in real-time. But when you film the process with a high-speed camera capable of capturing 30,000 frames every second , watching those kernels explode in super slow motion turns making popcorn into a spectacle that rivals the Fourth of July. Advertisement 
This macro footage was captured by YouTubeâ€™s Warped Perception channel using a Phantom v2512 ultra high speed camera, and reveals just how violent the popping process really is. Now who else suddenly has the munchies?
